Package me.elrod.pureio

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConsoleFileCoproduct<A>
    Here we demonstrate how you might use the concept of a coproduct to combine grammars of various types of I/O.
    ConsoleFileFree<A>
    Free (F => ConsoleFileCoproduct).
    ConsoleFileLib
    Provide an easier way to construct console or file operations
    Either<A,B>
    Disjunction sum type.
    Either.LeftP<A,B>
    Left projection of Either.
    Either.RightP<A,B>
    Right projection of Either.
    F
    Various utility functions for working with functions.
    FileLib
    This provides a nicer public API over the rest of the file IO code.
    FileOperation<A>
    A sum type for file-related operations one might perform.
    Identity<T>
    The identity monad and comonad, used primarily for delaying evaluation.
    LinkedList<A>
    A simple, purely functional linked-list implementation.
    LinkedList.Cons<A>  
    LinkedList.Nil<A>  
    Maybe<T>
    An optional type.
    Maybe.None<T>  
    Maybe.Some<T>  
    Monoid<A>
    A monoid is a semigroup with an identity element, satisfying the following laws in addition to the semigroup laws: âˆ€x.
    PureConsoleIO<A>
    A simple, untrampolined free IO monad: Free TerminalOperation.
    PureConsoleIOT<A>
    A trampolining free IO monad over TerminalOperation.
    PureFileIO<A>
    A simple, untrampolined free IO monad for file operations: Free FileOperation.
    Semigroup<A>
    A semigroup is an associative magma.
    TerminalLib
    This provides a nicer public API over the rest of the code.
    TerminalOperation<A>
    A sum type for all terminal-related operations one might perform.
    Trampoline<A>
    A trampoline is a sum type with two basic constructors: Pure and Suspend.
    TupleTwo<A,B>
    This is basically Identity except a two-product instead.
    Unit
    Unit value - same as Haskell's ().
    UnsafePerformIO
    A compatibility interpreter for our free IO monads to make them do things in a way that a typical Java environment might expect.
